project.title: Iodine Hall Thruster

primaryTaxonomyNodes.title: Electrostatic
primaryTaxonomyNodes.definition: This area covers electric propulsion systems that use electrostatic fields to ionize and accelerate a propellant.
primaryTaxonomyNodes.exampleTechnologies: Ion engines, hall thrusters, electrospray propulsion

project.benefits: NASA Unfunded and Planned: The capability for high _V maneuvers on SmallSats may enable low cost constellation deployment, orbit transfer to higher value orbits and provide station keeping for either formation flying or drag makeup. These capabilities enable geocentric applications including low-cost access to high value orbits, persistent coverage constellations, and required de-orbit capability. OGA: The capability for high _V maneuvers on SmallSats may enable low cost constellation deployment, orbit transfer to higher value orbits and provide station keeping for either formation flying or drag makeup. These capabilities enable geocentric applications including low-cost access to high value orbits, persistent coverage constellations, and required de-orbit capability. Commercial: The capability for high _V maneuvers on SmallSats may enable low cost constellation deployment, orbit transfer to higher value orbits and provide station keeping for either formation flying or drag makeup. These capabilities enable geocentric applications including low-cost access to high value orbits, persistent coverage constellations, and required de-orbit capability. Nation: The capability for high _V maneuvers on SmallSats may enable low cost constellation deployment, orbit transfer to higher value orbits and provide station keeping for either formation flying or drag makeup. These capabilities enable geocentric applications including low-cost access to high value orbits, persistent coverage constellations, and required de-orbit capability.
project.description: A Iodine Hall thruster electric propulsion system provides high delta-V performance which will enable missions previously unachievable with small spacecraft. The new propulsion system will take advantage of the ~2.4X improved propellant density to extend mission operations in low earth orbit and enable deep space planetary science missions.
